subject: Sales
title: Dollar Shave Club: Disruption With Humor
description: A 60-second lesson on Dollar Shave Club: Disruption With Humor.

hook.text: A YouTube video made for $4,500 launched Dollar Shave Club into a billion-dollar acquisition.

buildup.text: The video was raw, funny, and direct: 'Our blades are great.' It mocked overpriced razor companies.

discovery.text: Humor made the brand memorable and shareable. The video went viral, netting 12,000 orders in two days.

twist.text: The humor masked real strategy: simple pricing, direct-to-consumer delivery, and subscription ease.

climax.text: A bold voice plus a clear value proposition proved strong enough to topple entrenched industry giants.

punchline.text: A funny video and a sharp offer built an empire.

quiz.question: What strategy was hidden behind Dollar Shave Club's humor?
options: Simple pricing, direct delivery, and subscription convenience
